text: Acura has always taken a right-brain
approach to luxury for example the new
seven passenger MDX is not offered with
VA power no panoramic sunroof no
electric parking brake I'm Tom bulk with
driven for the New York Times it does
offer best-in-class fuel efficiency
powerful LED headlamps and easy access
useful things the luxury of practicality
now acura gets even more logical look no
rear driveshaft the acclaimed super
handling all-wheel drive system is
optional for the first time enthusiasts
will say wait super handling all-wheel
drive is one of the things that makes
MDX so great and that's true but there's
a lot of people in the Sunbelt that just
don't need it plus a front-wheel drive
MDX is less expensive to buy and just a
little bit more fuel efficient at
fifty-five thousand four hundred bucks
the only option missing on this vehicle
is the two thousand dollar super
handling all-wheel drive system the EPA
rates this front drive model at twenty
City twenty eight highway one or two
miles per gallon better than with all
wheel drive two of my friends that drove
this rig thought that it had all-wheel
drive even praised it maybe they felt
the effects of brake torque vectoring
that helps MDX corner exceptionally well
the Lexus crowd might find the sporty
ride quality a little too firm
preferring premium fuel the 3.5 liter
direct-injected v6 makes 290 horsepower
and can cruise using half of its Pistons
the 6-speed transmission has a sport
mode and full manual control mdx ways
some 275 pounds less now that's good for
sprinting zero to sixty happens in a
brisk six and a half seconds complete
with refined snarl it's noticeably
quieter inside as expected cabin
materials look rich
no trendy light piping or stitching on
the instrument panel that's - left brain
for Acura more practical is this huge
space that won't hold the kitchen sink
but this and more appropriately a laptop
fit fine the outgoing MDX had 41 buttons
on the center stack made it look like
the cockpit of a 747 the new one pairs
that down to nine and a multi-function
touchscreen much more logical but not
completely straightforward the mid row
is fully adjustable for legroom and
lounging outboard positions are heated
there are more features in this row
alone than some cars having total access
to the third row is easy these buttons
are illuminated best keep it two kids
back here even with the mid row slid
about halfway up adults are going to
play knees up mother Brown there's a
little bit more room behind the third
row now meaning you can put a fairly
good-sized cooler back here or in my
case three bundles of bath tissue
another way practical can be luxurious
the lid stays open at any angle seats
are easy to drop to create a flat floor
I always do the tipi trunk test with the
third row down and MDX scores a
respectable 15 packs of the two ply
emotionally it would be easy to fall for
the graceful lines of the aging Audi q7
or Volvo xc90 the Acura looks as if it
were styled by Vulcans not much passion
but the logical MDX gets a modern
structure that's designed to ace tough
new crash tests starting at around 43
grand the 2014 Acura MDX belongs on test
drive lists in front or all-wheel drive
high-end crossover shoppers
we'll find it practically luxurious
